p.s: Thank you for your email.
We can't wait for you to come here and meet us.
Your school the School ASchool A received the label: school without racism, school with courage.
Well this sounds fantastic at first but that doesn't mean that there are unfortunately not racial incidences.
That label that we have is from a network of schools.
Three-tousand actually.
And all schools who have this label are supporting the fight against racism.
Many people think that there is not a single school that doesn't has racism in some point.
There are only schools that fight against racism more than others.
Now I will tell you my experiences with racism at our school.
In the six or seven years I've been on the School ASchool A, I've heard of eight or nine racist actions and confrontations.
But in every single case there were students, that supported and helped the victim of the racial attack immediately.
Maybe there were more cases with a worse ending, but that were just my experiences.
To fight more against racism I find it important to talk about this topic more in school and school lessons.
Many teachers actually act like it's not that important and that everybody would know that racism is a bad thing, but I don't think so.
Children just learn racism.
It's not like they are racist just for fun, but many childbooks and movies present people of colour or people with a different religion as something weird or bad.
That's how children and young students learn it.
They just don't know it better.
We just have to talk more about it.
That's the only way we can prevent it.
I hope I could answer some of your questions.
Feel free to ask more.
